channel.title: Quotes of the Day
channel.description: Four humorous quotations each day from The Quotations Page
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Dave Barry
item.description: "You can only be young once. But you can always be immature."

item.title: Henry James
item.description: "She was a woman who, between courses, could be graceful with her elbows on the table."

item.title: Martin Mull
item.description: "The trouble with jogging is that the ice falls out of your glass."

item.title: Unknown
item.description: "Eat a live toad the first thing in the morning and nothing worse will happen to you the rest of the day."

item.title: Mark Twain
item.description: "The fact that man knows right from wrong proves his intellectual superiority to other creatures; but the fact that he can do wrong proves his moral inferiority to any creature that cannot."

item.title: Yogi Berra
item.description: "This is like deja vu all over again."

item.title: Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We have really everything in common with America nowadays except, of course, language."

item.title: Heinrich Heine
item.description: "There are more fools in the world than there are people."

item.title: William James
item.description: "There is only one thing a philosopher can be relied upon to do, and that is to contradict other philosophers."

item.title: Jules Renard
item.description: "Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired."

item.title: Jeannette Rankin
item.description: "You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake."

item.title: Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "Life is just one damned thing after another."
